title: CBC Comedy
text:
Workin' Moms (Stream now on CBC Gem) are bringing home the bacon – again. Created by Catherine Reitman, the second season of the show was nominated for an International Emmy Award for Best Comedy Series.

The show is up against three other nominated productions from Brazil, Israel and Singapore.

Reitman took to Instagram shortly after the announcement: "So proud of [the Workin' Moms] team... for representing Canada this year at the International Emmys!"

It's not the first time, either. In 2018, Workin' Moms was nominated for an International Emmy Award in the same category.

The International Emmy Awards are presented on November 25, 2019.

Characters from L to R: Frankie Coyne; Kate Foster; Anne Carlson.

Never seen Workin' Moms before?

Workin' Moms is a half-hour comedy about a group of career-focused moms juggling family, relationships and the ups-and-downs of modern womanhood.

Series creator Catherine Reitman plays Kate Foster, a busy executive fighting for her place at the table at a high-end PR firm. Her best friend, Ann Carlson — played by Dani Kind — is a psychiatrist with her own troubles wrangling her 9 year-old daughter and 8-month-old baby.

Frankie Coyne (Juno Rinaldi), the eager real estate agent, tries to rebound from post-partum blues while navigating relationship troubles with her wife. Calgary actor Jessalyn Wanlim plays Jenny Matthews, a woman who appears to be wholesome and innocent but is secretly tangled in a saucy office affair.

Stream Workin' Moms

Season 4 of Workin' Moms is slated for release next year. In the meantime, catch up on all three seasons streaming now on CBC Gem.
description: Catherine Reitman’s comedy show nominated for second year running
